The '''Eastfold''' was a region in the east of the realm of [[Rohan]], between the [[Folde]] in the west and the [[Fenmarch]] in the east, the river Entwash in the north and the [[White Mountains]] in the south.<ref name=N>{{HM|N}}, entry '''Folde''', pp. 770-71</ref><ref name=Map>{{RK|Map}}</ref>

The Eastfold was traversed by the [[Great West Road]] parallel to the White Mountains.<ref name=Map/> [[Edoras]], which was located in the ''Folde'' was also the defensive centre of the Eastfold.<ref name=N/>

A similar name, the '''East Dales''', are mentioned when it is told how the [[Rohirrim]] who had fallen in the [[Battle of the Hornburg]] were buried in two mounds; "those of the [[Westfold]] in one and those from the East Dales in another."<ref>{{TT|Road}}, p. 545</ref> It has been suggested that the name is a synonym for Eastfold.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 419</ref>

==History==
The Eastfold was originally part of the realm of [[Gondor]] until in {{TA|2510}} the fief of [[Calenardhon]] was granted to [[Eorl]] the Young by the [[Ruling Steward]] [[Cirion]]. Thereafter the Eastfold was part of Rohan. Initially the guarding and maintenance of the hill [[Halifirien]], which lay east of the [[Mering Stream]] in Gondor, was shared by men from Gondor and men from Rohan.<ref name=Eorl>{{UT|Eorl}}</ref>

When the realm of [[Gondor]] declined and was under threat by the sea and from the East and the people of Rohan increased, the wardens of the hill [[Halifirien]] were exclusively provided by the people of the Eastfold.<ref name=Eorl/>

On March 6 and 7<ref>{{HM|RC}}, citing from the amended time scheme, p. 508</ref> [[Gandalf]] rode with [[Peregrin Took]] through the Eastfold on the road to [[Minas Tirith]].<ref>{{RK|MT}}, p. 747</ref>

On March 11 {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 542</ref> the riders of Rohan led by their King [[Théoden]] travelled with [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]] through the Eastfold on their way to Minas Tirith.<ref>{{RK|Muster}}, p. 804</ref>

In early August {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 641</ref> the funeral escort of King Théoden passed through the Eastfold on its way to [[Edoras]].<ref>{{RK|Partings}}, p. 976</ref>

==Etymology==
''Eastfold'' is a name in the language of Rohan. It is a combination of "East" and ''fold'' from [[Old English]] ''folde'' ("earth", "land", "country").<ref name=N/>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Eastfold map.jpg|thumb|250px|Map of Eastfold in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2013: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Eastfold was released with the''[[The Lord of the Rings Online: Helm's Deep|Helm's Deep]]'' expansion and thus belongs to the [[Westemnet|West Rohan]] region despite being the easternmost point of Rohan proper. Aside from its capital city of [[Aldburg]] it also contains the towns of [[Fenmarch]] and Beaconwatch.
